change to the directory containing the downloaded file, and as the 'root' user

Have you run the .run file and completed the install?
Alright, we'll walk through it.  You're either logged in or looking at a login screen correct?  (black and white screen as you don't have X running)
alright log in if you haven't.  You should be in your home directory.
try this:  'cd Desktop' then type 'ls *.run'
Make sure you're in the same folder as the .run file.  If you are, run the command Pelo gave you.  That makes it executable.
You will also need to prepend the 'sh  NVIDIA-Linux-x86-96.43.05-pkg#.run' command with 'sudo'.
did it list your file?  I ask because the Desktop is the default download dir for Firefox..
Ah, alright, if it spit the name back then you're in the right spot.  run the command Pelo gave you 'chmod +x NVIDIA-Linux-x86-96.43.05-pkg1.run'
run this: 'sudo sh ./runNVIDIA-Linux-x86-96.43.05-pkg1.run'
the filename isn't runNVIDIA-Linux-x86-96.43.05-pkg1.run
join #zionpsyfer.
rejoin.
